Medical Sales Representative Job at Carrot-Top Drugs Limited




        
    

        
        Carrot-Top Drugs Limited was incorporated in 1997. It started business as a retail pharmacy on October 30th, 2000. In 2005, the company started her own brands of innovative and quality fertility products with Predict Ovulation Prediction Kit being her first.
     

            
    



Today, Carrot-Top Drugs Limited is a household name for couples trying for a baby. The company is built on a tripod of hard work, transparency, and commitment to our numerous customers. Our passion for fertility and wellness is borne out of our desire to see couples fulfilled and happy. Our various communication channels are inundated with testimonies of obviously satisfied customers. Our strength is in our skilled, courteous, and very innovative manpower, as well as our distribution capacity which has ensured all our choice brands, can be assessed anywhere in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Sales Representative

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates must possess a Degree in any of the following disciplines: Human Physiology, Anatomy, Pharmacology, Biochemistry, Microbiology or Biological Sciences.
	Have high moral/ ethical standards.
	Willing to take instructions and execute diligently.
	Motivated by extra money to be made legitimately in the field.
	Must be proficient in Driving.
	Candidate must be resident in Port Harcourt.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: admin@carrottopng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Uncle Stan&#39;s Foods is a small chops company known for it&#39;s unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Management Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly capable management accountant to optimize our financial management policies.
	You will be performing financial analysis, preparing financial forecasts, and advising senior management on strategic planning.
	To ensure success as a management accountant, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of financial analysis and forecasting and experience in a similar environment.
	An outstanding management accountant will be someone whose financial accounting and business management expertise translates into sustained business growth.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Reporting &amp; Analysis:


	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly management reports, including profit &amp; loss, balance sheet, and cash flow statements for all outlets.
	Analyze variances between actual and budgeted figures and provide actionable insights.
	Track performance metrics (e.g. food cost %, gross profit margins, outlet profitability).


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting:


	Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and periodic reforecasts for all branches and departments.
	Monitor budget compliance and investigate deviations in spending or revenue targets.


Cost Control &amp; Efficiency:


	Monitor and analyze food, labor, and overhead costs across the business.
	Recommend ways to improve cost efficiency without compromising quality or service delivery.
	Work with procurement and operations to implement cost-saving initiatives.


Financial Planning &amp; Strategy:


	Support the MD and management team with strategic financial planning.
	Participate in business expansion analysis, including feasibility studies for new outlet locations or services.


Internal Controls &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure accounting processes comply with internal policies, tax regulations, and financial best practices.
	Assist audit department in conducting internal audits and ensure financial controls are enforced.


Operational Support:


	Collaborate with operations managers to understand financial drivers of each outlet.
	Provide training to outlet managers on interpreting financial reports and managing budgets.


Data Management &amp; Systems:


	Maintain accurate and timely financial records using accounting software (e.g. QuickBooks, Sage, or any internal system).
	Improve data collection systems for better financial monitoring and reporting.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum 10 years of relevant experience, preferably in the food or retail industry.
	ACA, ACCA, or ICAN certification (preferred or in progress).
	Strong proficiency in Excel and financial reporting tools.
	Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills.
	Good communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Method of Application

Key Responsibilities
Financial Reporting & Analysis:


	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly management reports, including profit & loss, balance sheet, and cash flow statements for all outlets.
	Analyze variances between actual and budgeted figures and provide actionable insights.
	Track performance metrics (e.g. food cost %, gross profit margins, outlet profitability).


Budgeting & Forecasting:


	Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and periodic reforecasts for all branches and departments.
	Monitor budget compliance and investigate deviations in spending or revenue targets.


Cost Control & Efficiency:


	Monitor and analyze food, labor, and overhead costs across the business.
	Recommend ways to improve cost efficiency without compromising quality or service delivery.
	Work with procurement and operations to implement cost-saving initiatives.


Financial Planning & Strategy:


	Support the MD and management team with strategic financial planning.
	Participate in business expansion analysis, including feasibility studies for new outlet locations or services.


Internal Controls & Compliance:


	Ensure accounting processes comply with internal policies, tax regulations, and financial best practices.
	Assist audit department in conducting internal audits and ensure financial controls are enforced.


Operational Support:


	Collaborate with operations managers to understand financial drivers of each outlet.
	Provide training to outlet managers on interpreting financial reports and managing budgets.


Data Management & Systems:


	Maintain accurate and timely financial records using accounting software (e.g. QuickBooks, Sage, or any internal system).

	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

	ACA, ACCA, or ICAN certification (preferred or in progress).

	Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Payroll Specialist",
  "description": "At TeamAce, we help businesses across different industries thrive. We work with businesses to create their desired change by getting the right people, designing bespoke business processes, leveraging data, applying insights and technology. We combine our expertise and take different bespoke approaches to solve different business challenges because we believe there is no one size fits all approach. This way, you keep your eyes on the price and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Payroll Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Payroll Specialist to join our payroll team.
	The ideal candidate will have 2&ndash;3 years of experience in payroll, human resources, accounting, or consulting, with a strong understanding of payroll processes and statutory compliance. Professional certification is mandatory.
